page.title: 20Picnic at Dolebury Warren.
page.content: The school children, teachers and several parents spent an illuminating morning exploring this ancient Iron Age Hill Fort. The area, recently purchased by the National Trust, is 1,000 feet high and is approached by climbing steps cut into the side of the steep hill.Sheep grazing has been introduced by its new owners to emphasise the Hill Fort's original shape.Having climbed to the top, the children enjoyed seeing the archeological remains and learning about the history of the site.It is rare to see stones used for the banks.The sheep will certainly help reveal the Fort more fully and the new steps will encourage more visitors. After exploring we all had an enjoyable picnic on one side of a bank.
